summary: These documents discuss the CIA's Project HUNTER, a sensitive project involving the review of mail going to and from the Soviet Union. The FBI and CIA coordinated to identify individuals of interest and potential security risks. The documents outline procedures for sharing information and coordinating efforts between the two agencies. Also discussed is the process for examining correspondence for secret writing, micro dots and possibly codes. The documents also request adding and removing names from the watch list as well as adding people who are current and former Soviet exchange students, researchers and scientists, and Soviets who have U.S. contacts who are subversive
title: Coverage of Mail to the U.S.S.R.
